# SymmetricKeySize

**Structure**

The sizes that a symmetric cryptographic key can take.

## Declaration

```swift
struct SymmetricKeySize
```

## Overview

When creating a new [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SymmetricKey] instance with a call to its [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SymmetricKey/init(size:)] initializer, you typically use one of the standard key sizes, like [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SymmetricKeySize/bits128], [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SymmetricKeySize/bits192], or [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SymmetricKeySize/bits256]. When you need a key with a non-standard length, use the [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SymmetricKeySize/init(bitCount:)] initializer to create a `SymmetricKeySize` instance with a custom bit count.

## Using standard key lengths

- **bits128**: A size of 128 bits.
- **bits192**: A size of 192 bits.
- **bits256**: A size of 256 bits.

## Creating a nonstandard key length

- **init(bitCount:)**: Creates a new key size of the given length.

## Getting the length

- **bitCount**: The number of bits in the key.

## Message authentication codes

- **HMAC**: A hash-based message authentication algorithm.
- **SymmetricKey**: A symmetric cryptographic key.

## Conforms To

- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
